thread.title: Police hunting murderer after armed gang help him escape prison | Metro News
thread.title_full: Police hunting murderer after armed gang help him escape prison | Metro News

author: Tomeyjes For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Police hunting murderer after armed gang help him escape prison | Metro News
text: Toby Meyjes for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 21 Feb 2017 7:27 pm Shaun Walmsley is serving a minimum 30 year sentence (Picture: Merseyside Police) Police are hunting a convicted murderer after an armed gang helped him escaped from prison in Liverpool. Shaun Walmsley, who is serving a minimum 30 years sentence, was being escorted from a hospital visit in a minicab when it is claimed men armed with knives and pepper spray helped him escape. Millionaire ordered to pay his two sons more than Â£1.5m after killing their mother Police have launched an urgent investigation to try and find him. Walmsley and two other men were jailed in 2015 for the murder of Anthony Duffy, 33. Their victim was stabbed and slashed 28 times and later died. More
